intro: Diplotaxis vernalis, commonly known as spring diplotaxis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces slender, branched stems and has alternate, linear leaves. Diplotaxis vernalis is often found in coastal and inland regions, and it is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
